registers.name: RXFILTERLOWTHRESH
registers.info: Receive Filter Low Priority Frame Threshold Register

fields.info: Receive filter low threshold.

registers.name: RX0FLOWTHRESH
registers.info: Receive Channel 0 Flow Control Threshold Register

fields.info: Receive flow threshold.

registers.name: RX0FREEBUFFER
registers.info: Receive Channel 0 Free Buffer Count Register

fields.info: Receive free buffer count. These bits contain the count of free buffers available.
RMII interface transmit and receive speed select.
Receive offset / length word write block.
Receive ownership write bit value.
Command Idle bit
Transmit Short Gap Enable
Transmit queue priority type
Transmit pacing enable bit
GMII enable bit
Transmit flow control enable bit.
Receive buffer flow control enable bit
Loopback mode. The loopback mode forces internal full-duplex mode regardless of the FULLDUPLEX bit.
Full duplex mode.
EMAC idle bit. This bit is cleared to 0 at reset; one clock after reset, it goes to 1.
Transmit host error code. These bits indicate that EMAC detected transmit DMA related host errors.
Transmit host error channel. These bits indicate which transmit channel the host error occurred on.
Receive host error code. These bits indicate that EMAC detected receive DMA related host errors.
Receive host error channel. These bits indicate which receive channel the host error occurred on.
Receive Quality of Service (QOS) active bit.
Receive flow control active bit.
Transmit flow control active bit.
Emulation soft bit.
Emulation free bit.
Transmit FIFO cell threshold.
Transmit cell depth. These bits indicate the number of cells in the transmit FIFO.
Receive cell depth. These bits indicate the number of cells in the receive FIFO.
Address type
MAC configuration value
Software reset. Writing a 1 to this bit causes the EMAC logic to be reset.

registers.name: MACSRCADDRLO
registers.info: MAC Source Address Low Bytes Register

fields.info: MAC source address lower 8-0 bits (byte 0)
MAC source address bits 15-8 (byte 1)

registers.name: MACSRCADDRHI
registers.info: MAC Source Address High Bytes Register

fields.info: MAC source address bits 23-16 (byte 2)
MAC source address bits 31-24 (byte 3)
MAC source address bits 39-32 (byte 4)
MAC source address bits 47-40 (byte 5)
Least-significant 32 bits of the hash table corresponding to hash values 0 to 31.
Most-significant 32 bits of the hash table corresponding to hash values 32 to 63.
Backoff random number generator.
Collision count. These bits indicate the number of collisions the current frame has experienced.
Backoff count.
Pacing register current value. A nonzero value in this field indicates that transmit pacing is active.
Receive pause timer value.
Transmit pause timer value.
Address valid bit.
Match or filter bit
Channel select. Determines which receive channel a valid address match will be transferred to.
MAC address lower 8-0 bits (byte 0)
MAC address bits 15-8 (byte 1)
MAC source address bits 23-16 (byte 2)
MAC source address bits 31-24 (byte 3)
MAC source address bits 39-32 (byte 4)
MAC source address bits 47-40 (byte 5). Bit 40 is the group bit. It is forced to 0 and read as 0.
MAC address index. All eight addresses share the upper 40 bits.

registers.name: TX0HDP
registers.info: Transmit Channel 0 DMA Head Descriptor Pointer Register

fields.info: Transmit channel n DMA Head Descriptor pointer.

registers.name: RX0HDP
registers.info: Receive Channel 0 DMA Head Descriptor Pointer Register

fields.info: Receive channel n DMA Head Descriptor pointer.
Transmit channel n completion pointer register is written by the host with the buffer descriptor
Receive channel n completion pointer register is written by the host with the buffer descriptor
Receive channel n completion pointer register is written by the host with the buffer descriptor
